Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0465E=JSAS0465E: [{0}] THE SECURITY SERVICE HAS ALREADY BEEN INITIALIZED WITH THIS ORB. The ServiceInit (the call that enables security) will return immediately without reinitializing security multiple times.
Message.Explanation: This error indicates that security for this object request broker (ORB) has already been initialized and an attempt to initialize it again is occurring.
Message.UserResponse: The ServiceInit method, the call that enables security, will return immediately without reinitializing the security. Enable trace to determine what called the ServiceInit method a second time. See the problem determination information on the WebSphere Application Server Support Web page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1454I=JSAS1454I: The indicated entry was not found in the key file.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0602E=JSAS0602E: No valid transport tagged components exist in the IOR.
Message.Explanation: The transport tag is not a recognized or supported transport.
Message.UserResponse: Determine what transports are supported on the server you are connecting to by examining the security configuration and the sas.server.props file.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0638E=JSAS0638E: [{0}] Client authentication required at the server but no principal information is present in the {1} method request from client {2}.
Message.Explanation: When client authentication is required at the server, a principal must be sent for the request to be handled.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure that the client is configured with the correct credentials to issue a request to this server.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0529I=JSAS0529I: No perform client authentication at transport layer has been set.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0320E=JSAS0320E: [{0}] Connection type found in session entry was not valid for this security context. Ensure that the security configuration has the SSL keyStore and trustStore properties specified, and that the keystore file has valid, non-expired certificates.
Message.Explanation: The connection type was not SSL.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure that the security configuration has the SSL keyStore and trustStore properties specified, and that the keystore file has valid, non-expired certificates.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0464E=JSAS0464E: [{0}] I/O Error while writing the security bootstrap repository. Stop the adminserver, rename this file to anything else, restart your adminserver and the file should get recreated. Try running "java com.ibm.ISecurityUtilityImpl.BootstrapRepository %WAS_ROOT%/etc/secbootstrap" to see if it can be read. Make sure %WAS_ROOT% points to the correct WebSphere install path. {1}
Message.Explanation: The file pointed to by BootstrapRepositoryLocation property in the security configuration has been corrupted.
Message.UserResponse: Stop the server and rename the file pointed to by the BootstrapRepositoryLocation class. After renaming the file, restart your server and the file should get recreated. Try running "java com.ibm.ISecurityUtilityImpl.BootstrapRepository %WAS_ROOT%/etc/secbootstrap" from the command line to see if the new file can be read. Make sure %WAS_ROOT% points to the correct installation path.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1453I=JSAS1453I: The SSL server keystore password has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0601E=JSAS0601E: The CSIv2 client configuration does not support SECIOP.
Message.Explanation: The implementation does not support Secure Inter-ORB Protocol (SECIOP).
Message.UserResponse: Communication to a server over SECIOP is not valid. You must communicate to the server over IIOP.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0637E=JSAS0637E: [{0}] KeyManagementException - This is the general key management exception, for all operations dealing with key management. Subclasses could include: KeyIDConflict, KeyAuthorizationFailureException, ExpiredKeyException. Exception: {1}
Message.Explanation: This is the general key management exception for all operations dealing with key management. Subclasses include: KeyIDConflict, KeyAuthorizationFailureException, ExpiredKeyException.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the certificates within the keystore are not expired and can all be viewed from within the IKeyMan program.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1409I=JSAS1409I: The principal has been set: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0528I=JSAS0528I: Perform client authentication at transport layer supported has been set. <performTLClientAuthenticationSupported>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0355E=JSAS0355E: [{0}] Duplicate security attribute type specified. Verify the program to ensure that the same attribute is not trying to be retrieved more than once at the same time. {1}
Message.Explanation: This error indicates that the same attribute in the credential object is being accessed more than once for a single call to the get_attributes method.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure that multiple attempts are not being made to retrieve a single attribute at the same time.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0463E=JSAS0463E: [{0}] I/O Error while processing the security bootstrap repository. Stop the adminserver, rename this file to anything else, restart your adminserver and the file should get recreated. Try running "java com.ibm.ISecurityUtilityImpl.BootstrapRepository %WAS_ROOT%/etc/secbootstrap" to see if it can be read. Make sure %WAS_ROOT% points to the correct WebSphere install path. /WebSphere/AppServer. {1}
Message.Explanation: The file pointed to by the BootstrapRepositoryLocation property in the security configuration has been corrupted.
Message.UserResponse: Stop the server and rename the file pointed to by the BootstrapRepositoryLocation class. After renaming the file, restart your server and the file should get recreated. Try running "java com.ibm.ISecurityUtilityImpl.BootstrapRepository %WAS_ROOT%/etc/secbootstrap" from the command line to see if the new file can be read. Make sure %WAS_ROOT% points to the correct installation path.

Message.MsgText: security.ClientCSI=JSAS0007I: Client request interceptor registered.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0499E=JSAS0499E: The server ID that is received for identity assertion ({0}) does not match any of the configured and trusted server IDs ({1}).
Message.Explanation: The Common Secure Interoperability version 2 (CSIv2) inbound configuration panel does not have the noted server ID configured correctly.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the server ID that is listed in the message is added to the trusted server list in the CSIv2 inbound authentication panel.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1452I=JSAS1452I: The SSL server keystore has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0600E=JSAS0600E: CSIv2 Tagged Component is NULL.
Message.Explanation: The Interoperable Object Reference (IOR) from the server does not contain a Common Secure Interoperability version 2 (CSIv2) tagged component.
Message.UserResponse: The server might need to be restarted. Also the check the client configuration and redeploy the object.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0636E=JSAS0636E: [{0}] NoSuchProviderException - This exception is thrown when a particular security provider is requested but is not available in the environment. Exception: {1}
Message.Explanation: This exception is created when a specific security provider is requested but it is not available in your environment.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm that the keyStoreProvider, trustStoreProvider property, and sslContextProvider propreties have valid security providers specified.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0809E=JSAS0809E: The current OID is RSA but this is not an Admin request.
Message.Explanation: The RSA authentication mechanism is only for admin requests but is being used for an application request.
Message.UserResponse: If this continues, try changing the admin mechanism to LTPA and ensure the realm is trusted and LTPA keys are the same between processes.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1408I=JSAS1408I: The key file name has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0527I=JSAS0527I: Perform client authentication at transport layer required has been set. <performTLClientAuthenticationRequired>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0462E=JSAS0462E: [{0}] I/O Error trying to open the security bootstrap repository. Check the property bootstrapRepositoryLocation in the security configuration to be sure it points to a valid filename and location. If the path is correct, rename the file to allow it to recreate a new file. {1}
Message.Explanation: An error occurred while opening the file pointed to by the bootstrapRepositoryLocation property.
Message.UserResponse: Check the bootstrapRepositoryLocation property in the security configuration to be sure it points to a valid filename and location. If the path is correct, rename the file to allow it to recreate a new file.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0498E=JSAS0498E: [{0}] The loginSource property contains an illegal option; the default is {1}.
Message.Explanation: Valid loginSource options are: prompt, properties, stdin, key file, key table, and none.
Message.UserResponse: Provide a valid source for the loginSource property.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1451I=JSAS1451I: The configuration appears to be passively correct.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0635E=JSAS0635E: [{0}] UnrecoverableKeyException - This exception is thrown if a key in the keystore cannot be recovered. Exception: {1}
Message.Explanation: This exception is created if a key in the keystore file can not be recovered.
Message.UserResponse: This usually indicates the keystore file has been corrupted. Ensure that the keystore type specified is valid, as this is another possible cause for this exception.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0808E=JSAS0808E: The preferred admin authentication mechanism is not a known ADMIN mechanism.
Message.Explanation: The supported admin authentication mechanisms are RSA, LTPA, and KRB5.
Message.UserResponse: Another authentication mechanism besides one of the supported mechanisms is configured incorrectly.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0100W=JSAS2100W: [{0}] Null Credentials list. If an unauthenticated request is not desired, check the client login userid/password to verify correctness. Review the login source property in the sas.client.props.
Message.Explanation: The credentials list passed into the init_security_context method are null. An unauthenticated request will be attempted.
Message.UserResponse: If you do not want to attempt an unauthenticated, confirm the user name and password used for the client login are correct. Review the login source property in the sas.client.props file.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0418E=JSAS0418E: [{0}] The configuration has not been initialized. Ensure that the security configuration is complete and in the location specified by the com.ibm.CORBA.ConfigURL. This location is typically WASROOT/properties.
Message.Explanation: This indicates that the security configuration has not been processed.
Message.UserResponse: Verify the security configuration is complete in the sas.client.props file, including the location of the file specified by the com.ibm.CORBA.ConfigURL property. The most common location is <was_root>/properties.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1407I=JSAS1407I: The keytab file name has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0180E=JSAS0180E: [{0}] Unable to get PrincipalAuthenticator from Current. Check the security configuration to ensure that the authenticationTarget is set properly.
Message.Explanation: The problem is typically related to the security configuration.
Message.UserResponse: Check the security configuration to ensure that the authenticationTarget is set properly.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0807W=JSAS0807W: The current OID is not the preferred admin authentication mechanism of KRB5.
Message.Explanation: This occurs when a tag contains an OID that does not match to target KRB5 OID.
Message.UserResponse: The target server does not have KRB5 configured.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0526I=JSAS0526I: No perform secure transport layer has been set.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0100E=JSAS0100E: [{0}] Null target security name. Verify that the principalName specified in the server configuration is valid.
Message.Explanation: The target security object retrieved from a security tagged component in the Interoperable Object Reference (IOR) is null.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the principalName field specified in the server configuration is valid.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0461E=JSAS0461E: [{0}] Invalid credential token, unable to validate. Retry the operation after a few minutes. If using request_login for Domino, ensure that Domino/WebSphere SSO is setup correctly.
Message.Explanation: The credential token is null, expired, or has been tampered with. The token is digitally signed, so any modification of the bytes in the token can not be verified. The most common reason for this error is a null token.
Message.UserResponse: Retry the operation after a few minutes. If using the request_login method for Domino, confirm that single signon (SSO) between the Domino server and the WebSphere Applpication Server has been configured correctly.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0497E=JSAS0497E: [{0}] A problem occurred while decoding the HardwareTokenPassword property. {1}
Message.Explanation: The password for the hardware crypto device could not be decoded properly.
Message.UserResponse: Go back to the configuration and retype the password.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1450I=JSAS1450I: The configuration appears to be consistent.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0634E=JSAS0634E: [{0}] KeyStoreException - This is the generic KeyStore exception. Exception: {1}
Message.Explanation: This is a general exception that occurs when trying to access a keystore file.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure the following are all correct: the location of the keystore, the password used to access the keystore and the keystore type.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0071E=JSAS0071E: [{0}] NO_PERMISSION caught, unable to complete secure association at the client. Retry the client program after a few minutes wait. Ensure that the client program is using the correct version of SAS.JAR in the classpath. {1}
Message.Explanation: An attempt to establish a secure association with the server resulted with a NO_PERMISSION error.
Message.UserResponse: Retry the client program after a few minutes wait. Ensure that the client program is using the correct version of the sas.jar file in the classpath.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0417E=JSAS0417E: [{0}] The active correctness verification produced a verification result of {1}
Message.Explanation: The expected verification result is Success(0). The other possible verification results are Unknown (-1), ConfigIncomplete (1), ConfigInconsistent (2), and ConfigWrong (3).
Message.UserResponse: This error will be preceded by additional error messages with further information.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1406I=JSAS1406I: The login password has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0806W=JSAS0806W: The current OID is not the preferred admin authentication mechanism of LTPA.
Message.Explanation: This occurs when a tag contains an OID that does not match to target LTPA OID.
Message.UserResponse: The target server does not have LTPA configured.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0525I=JSAS0525I: Perform secure transport layer with SSL/TLS supported has been set. <performTransportAssocSSLTLSRequired>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0070W=JSAS2070W: [{0}] Session entry already exists. Try to login again.
Message.Explanation: This message indicates that the session being added has already been added.
Message.UserResponse: Try to log in again.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0027E=JSAS0027E: [{0}] ORB data conversion exception. This typically occurs when the ORB is processing a data string with characters that are not consistent with the code pages supported by the ORB. Refer to product documentation for additional information. {1}
Message.Explanation: An internal exception occurred. The probable cause is that a data string processed by the Object Request Broker (ORB), such as the server's realm/name, contains characters that are not consistent with the code pages supported by the ORB.
Message.UserResponse: Check the security configuration files to ensure that data strings contain only characters from code pages that are supported by the Object Request Broker (ORB).

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0496E=JSAS0496E: [{0}] The expiration time for {1} credentials is too short relative to the ORB request timeout and/or the security cache timeout; a method request could take longer than the period over which the credentials will remain valid, or the credentials could expire while in the server cache.
Message.Explanation: A method request could take longer than the credential expiration period.
Message.UserResponse: Either increase the cache timeout or decrease the Object Request Broker (ORB) request timeout.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0633E=JSAS0633E: [{0}] NoSuchAlgorithmException - This exception is thrown when a particular cryptographic algorithm is requested but is not available in the environment. Exception: {1}
Message.Explanation: This exception is occurs when a particular cryptographic algorithm is requested but is not available in the environment.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm the cipher and security provider specified in the SSL configuration are valid.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0070E=JSAS0070E: [{0}] Unable to complete secure association at the client. Retry the client program after a few minutes wait. {1}
Message.Explanation: An attempt to communicate with the server was not successful.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm that your server is running and that the port and host configurations are correct.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0416E=JSAS0416E: [{0}] The configuration is in an unknown state. If you get this error, other errors will have preceded it which describe the problems with the configuration.
Message.Explanation: The verification levels are Completeness, Consistency, PassivelyCorrect and ActivelyCorrect. The default for com.ibm.CORBA.verificationLevel is Consistency. The valid verification levels are Completeness, Consistency, PassivelyCorrect and ActivelyCorrect. Based on the level you have selected, your configuration can not be verified as correct.
Message.UserResponse: This error will be preceded by additional error messages with further information.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1405I=JSAS1405I: The login userid has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0805W=JSAS0805W: The current OID is not the preferred admin authentication mechanism of RSAToken.
Message.Explanation: This occurs when a tag contains an OID that does not match to target RSAToken OID.
Message.UserResponse: No action required unless RSAToken OID never appears. In that case it should fall back to LTPA.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0524I=JSAS0524I: Perform secure transport layer with SSL/TLS required has been set. <performTransportAssocSSLTLSRequired>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0026E=JSAS0026E: [{0}] Exception connecting object to the ORB. Check the SSL configuration to ensure that the SSL keyStore and trustStore properties are set properly. Ensure that the keystore has at least one personal certificate and that the signer for the personal certificate is added to the truststore. Attempt loading the keystore and truststore into WebSphere''s IKeyMan and ensure that the file type specified in the configuration (usually JKS) is the correct file type. Make sure the password specified for the keystore and truststore is valid. Use the same password for both keystore and truststore. {1}
Message.Explanation: An internal exception occurred. Your server key ring is not valid, does not contain a server certificate, or cannot be found.
Message.UserResponse: Check the SSL configuration to ensure that the SSL keyStore and trustStore properties are set properly. Ensure that the keystore has at least one personal certificate and that the signer for the personal certificate is added to the truststore. Attempt loading the keystore and truststore into IKeyMan and ensure that the file type specified in the configuration (usually JKS) is the correct file type. Make sure the password specified for the keystore and truststore is valid. Use the same password for both keystore and truststore.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0495E=JSAS0495E: [{0}] The server''s {1} credentials are invalid. Realm/security_name == NULL.
Message.Explanation: The server's credentials are invalid.
Message.UserResponse: Try to log in again specifying a realm, user name, or both.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0632E=JSAS0632E: [{0}] PrivilegedActionException reading com.ibm.CORBA.ConfigURL={1}. Exception: {2}
Message.Explanation: The SecurityManager needs read access to read the com.ibm.CORBA.ConfigURL property.
Message.UserResponse: Specify at least read access for this property in the java.security file.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0415E=JSAS0415E: [{0}] The configuration is incorrect. If you get this error, other errors will have preceded it which describe the problems with the configuration.
Message.Explanation: The verification levels are Completeness, Consistency, PassivelyCorrect and ActivelyCorrect. The default for com.ibm.CORBA.verificationLevel is Consistency. The valid verification levels are Completeness, Consistency, PassivelyCorrect and ActivelyCorrect. Based on the level you have selected, your configuration can not be verified as correct.
Message.UserResponse: This error will be preceded by additional error messages with further information.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1404I=JSAS1404I: The login source has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0523I=JSAS0523I: Perform stateless has been enabled.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0350E=JSAS0350E: [{0}] Security attribute type is null or invalid. Verify the program to ensure that the attribute being accessed is a valid credential attribute. You may need to contact your system administrator to verify that all of the attributes you need have been set in the user registry. {1}
Message.Explanation: A security attribute is a value stored in the credential object such as userid or groupid. Either the type trying to be accessed is not a valid credential attribute type or the attribute being accessed is null.
Message.UserResponse: Verify the program to ensure that the attribute being accessed is a valid credential attribute. You may need to contact your system administrator to verify that all of the attributes you need have been set in the user registry.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0025E=JSAS0025E: [{0}] Null reference to ORB. The problem may be an out of memory error. Restart the server machine and try again.
Message.Explanation: This message indicates that a reference to the Object Request Broker (ORB) was null.
Message.UserResponse: The problem may be an out of memory error. Restart the server machine and try again.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0494E=JSAS0494E: [{0}] The server''s {1} credentials are NULL.
Message.Explanation: The server did not set the credentials during the bootstrap process.
Message.UserResponse: Try restarting the server. Report the problem to customer support.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0631E=JSAS0631E: [{0}] Exception reading com.ibm.CORBA.ConfigURL={1}. Exception: {2}
Message.Explanation: The file specified by the com.ibm.CORBA.ConfigURL property does not exist or is not in a valid format.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm the file exists in the location specified. If the file exists in that location, ensure the URL is in the valid format.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0804E=JSAS0804E: An error occurred trying to create an admin RSA token using target certificate with distinguished name of {0}. The exception message is: {1}.
Message.Explanation: The RSA token could not be created due to an error with the target certificate or the Subject.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure there's a valid Subject on the thread or that the target certificate was received. Check FFDC logs for related errors.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0241E=JSAS0241E: [{0}] Attempting to receive LocalOS credential from remote node. LocalOS credentials are only supported on the same node.
Message.Explanation: This message indicates that the LocalOS credential is trying to access a resource on a node other than the one it was authenticated on.
Message.UserResponse: Verify your code to determine if there is a naming lookup or an Enterprise Java Bean (EJB) accessing another node.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0414E=JSAS0414E: [{0}] The configuration is incorrect; the server may not start or may not function correctly. If you get this error, other errors will have preceded it which describe the problems with the configuration.
Message.Explanation: The verification levels are Completeness, Consistency, PassivelyCorrect and ActivelyCorrect. The default for com.ibm.CORBA.verificationLevel is Consistency. The valid verification levels are Completeness, Consistency, PassivelyCorrect and ActivelyCorrect. Based on the level you have selected, your configuration can not be verified as correct.
Message.UserResponse: This error will be preceded by additional error messages with further information.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1439I=JSAS1439I: The claim message confidentiality required has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0522I=JSAS0522I: Perform stateful has been enabled.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0493E=JSAS0493E: [{0}] Identity type stored in the credential (ITTDistinguishedName) does not match the effective policy Identity type (ITTDistinguishedName not supported).
Message.Explanation: The server does not support distinguished name based credentials.
Message.UserResponse: In order to communicate with this downstream server using Identity Assertion, the originating client should try a different authentication mechanism which is principal based rather than DN based.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0630E=JSAS0630E: [{0}] IOException reading com.ibm.CORBA.ConfigURL={1}. Exception: {2}
Message.Explanation: The file specified by the com.ibm.CORBA.ConfigURL property does not exist or is not in a valid format.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm the file exists in the location specified. If the file exists in that location, ensure the URL is in the valid format.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0803E=JSAS0803E: The received admin RSA token failed validation. The exception message is: {0}
Message.Explanation: The token received could not be validated. This will typically occur when the signer of the sending process was not stored in the admin trust store.
Message.UserResponse: If there error is related to validating certificates, then find out the sending process and add the sending server's signer certificate to the receiving server's trust store.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0240E=JSAS0240E: [{0}] Login failed. Verify the userid/password is correct. Check the properties file to ensure the login source is valid. If this error occurs on the server, check the server properties to ensure the principalName has a valid realm and userid. {1}
Message.Explanation: This message indicates that the attempt at authenticating was not successful.
Message.UserResponse: Verify the user name and password are correct. Check the sas.client.props properties file to ensure the login source is valid. If this error occurs on the server, check the sas.server.props properties file to ensure the principalName property has a valid realm and user name.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0413E=JSAS0413E: [{0}] A problem occurred while processing the security configuration. Verify the data entered in the security configuration is valid. {1}
Message.Explanation: A java runtime exception occurred when processing the security configuration.
Message.UserResponse: Review your security configuration to ensure that all the values are valid.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0449E=JSAS0449E: [{0}] The SSL tagged component was not correctly formed and can not be parsed. Ensure that the server version you are trying to connect to is supported. Make sure the SAS.JAR you are using on the client side is compatible with that of the server. {1}
Message.Explanation: A SystemException error occurred when parsing the tagged component.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm that you are connecting to a supported server version. Ensure that the sas.jar file you are using on the client side is compatible with that server.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1402I=JSAS1402I: Security has been enabled.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1438I=JSAS1438I: The claim message integrity required has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0521I=JSAS0521I: No claim identity assertion has been set.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0492E=JSAS0492E: [{0}] Identity type stored in the credential (ITTPrincipalName) does not match the effective policy Identity type (ITTPrincipalName not supported).
Message.Explanation: The server does not support principal based credentials.
Message.UserResponse: In order to communicate with this downstream server using Identity Assertion, the originating client should try a different authentication mechanism such as SSL client certificates.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0802E=JSAS0802E: The received admin RSA token has a nonce value that has been used recently in this process. This could indicate a replay attack."
Message.Explanation: A nonce is a value that can be used only once to prevent replay attacks. This token uses a nonce for this purpose and has received the same nonce more than once.
Message.UserResponse: A replay attack may have occurred. Some investigation of the sending process may be warrented.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0412E=JSAS0412E: [{0}] The SSLV3SessionTimeout property contains a non-integer string value; using default value of {1}. Correct the value specified in the property so that it is an integer number.
Message.Explanation: An integer value must be specified for this property.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm that the value specified in the property is an integer.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1401I=JSAS1401I: The configuration has been initialized.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1437I=JSAS1437I: The claim message out-of-sequence detection required has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0520I=JSAS0520I: Claim identity assertion supported has been set. <claimIdentityAssertionSupported>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0130E=JSAS0130E: [{0}] Client credentials were not valid. Restart the client so that it logs in with new credentials. Once client credentials are marked invalid, they must be thrown away and news ones created. {1}
Message.Explanation: This message indicates that the client credentials were marked invalid. This could be because the credential token expired, the user name and password were not confirmed, or the security server was not available to verify the user information.
Message.UserResponse: Restart the client so that it logs in with new credentials. Once client credentials are marked invalid, they must be thrown away and news ones created.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0491E=JSAS0491E: [{0}] Identity type stored in the credential (Client certificates) does not match the effective policy Identity type (ITTX509CertChain not supported).
Message.Explanation: The server does not support certificate based credentials.
Message.UserResponse: In order to communicate with this downstream server using Identity Assertion, the originating client should try a different authentication mechanism such as BasicAuth.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1480I=JSAS1480I: Security is not enabled because the ConfigURL property file is not set.
Message.Explanation: The com.ibm.CORBA.ConfigURL property specified in setupCmdLine.bat or on the java command line is not set.
Message.UserResponse: To enable security, set the com.ibm.CORBA.ConfigURL property to a properties file which exists, such as the sas.client.props file.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0801E=JSAS0801E: The received admin RSA token has an expired timestamp of {0} where the current local timestamp is {1}. Check for clock skew issues between servers.
Message.Explanation: The timestamp in the RSA token is later than the current time of the receiving server.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure there are no clock skews between servers. Increase the RSA tokenExpiration if the default of 10 minutes is not sufficient for a one-time use token.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0411E=JSAS0411E: [{0}] The SSLV3SessionTimeout property is out of range; using default value of {1}. Correct the value specified so that it is within the valid range.
Message.Explanation: The valid range of values for the SSLV3SessionTimeout property is between 0 and 86,400 seconds.
Message.UserResponse: Correct the value specified so that it is within the valid range.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0447E=JSAS0447E: [{0}] The security tagged component assistor is not an ObjectImpl and therefore can not be registered with the ORB. Check to ensure you have the same version of SAS.JAR as the server. Check the dates of the file on the server to ensure they match the dates of other JAR files on the server in case a mismatch has occurred.
Message.Explanation: The SecurityTaggedComponentAssistorImpl.class file in the SAS.JAR is not valid.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure that you have the same version of the sas.jar file as on the server. To confirm you are using the correct version, compare the dates to ensure that they match the dates of the other jar files on the server.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1400I=JSAS1400I: The configuration appears to be actively correct.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1436I=JSAS1436I: The claim message replay detection required has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0490E=JSAS0490E: [{0}] Identity type stored in the credential (Client Authentication Token) does not match the effective policy Identity type (ITTPrincipalName not supported).
Message.Explanation: The type of credential is not one that is supported for Identity Assertion.
Message.UserResponse: Review the client configuration, specifically the authenticationTarget property to ensure it contains a supported value.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0020W=JSAS2020W: [{0}] Unable to get credentials. Verify the userid/password supplied is correct. Try restarting the client program to resolve the problem. Increasing the credential timeout value could reduce the likelihood of this error occurring.
Message.Explanation: The credentials supplied are either invalid or null. An attempt is being made to login as unauthenticated. If the resource is unprotected, the invocation should succeed.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the user name and password supplied are correct. Try restarting the client program to resolve the problem. Increasing the credential timeout value could reduce the likelihood of this error occurring.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0410E=JSAS0410E: [{0}] The SSLPort property contains a non-integer string value; using the default value of {1}. Correct the value specified in the property so that it is an integer number.
Message.Explanation: An integer value must be specified for this property.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm that the value specified in the property is an integer.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0446E=JSAS0446E: [{0}] The listening port has not been initialized yet. Check the configuration to ensure there is not a property which inadvertently sets the port to something already using it. Stop the server and wait for about 2 minutes before restarting the server so that all ports that were in use will be released.
Message.Explanation: This indicates that the port specified in the server connection data is 0.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm that a property was not set to a port that is already being used. The server should be stopped. After waiting about 2 minutes to allow the ports to be released, restart the server.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1435I=JSAS1435I: The claim server-authentication required has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0619E=JSAS0619E: The sending server requires Identity Assertion but the receiving server does not support it.
Message.Explanation: The receiving server has not been configured for Identity Assertion. It is a requirement of the sending server that the receiving server be configured for Identity Assertion.
Message.UserResponse: Modify the configuration on the receiving server to support Identity Assertion.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0020E=JSAS0020E: [{0}] Null reference to LoginHelper. The problem may be an out of memory error. Restart the server machine and try again.
Message.Explanation: This message indicates an internal error occurred when trying to create an instance of the LoginHelperImpl class.
Message.UserResponse: The problem may be an out of memory error. Restart the server machine and try again.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0445E=JSAS0445E: [{0}] Unknown host. An attempt will be made to use the host name, however, if this fails you''ll need to take action. Contact your network administrator to ensure that the hostname and IP address which you have configured on the server is valid. {1}
Message.Explanation: The host name could not be converted into the dotted IP address form.
Message.UserResponse: An attempt will be made to use the host name, however, if this fails you'll need to take action. Contact your network administrator to ensure that the hostname and IP address which you have configured on the server is valid.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1434I=JSAS1434I: The claim client-authentication required has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0618E=JSAS0618E: The target security name is NULL in CSIv2 tagged component.
Message.Explanation: A value in the Common Secure Interoperability version 2 (CSIv2) tagged component required for client authentication is null.
Message.UserResponse: Try using SSL client authentication or contact the system administrator.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0380E=JSAS0380E: [{0}] Security attribute list contains null member. Verify that the list of attributes that is trying to be set does not contain a null attribute. Retry the operation.
Message.Explanation: The attribute list contained a member which was null when the call was made to the set_attributes method on the credential.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the list of attributes that is trying to be set does not contain a null member. Retry the operation.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0199E=JSAS0199E: [{0}] Security server could not be initialized. The probable cause for this problem is that the class com.ibm.WebSphereSecurityImpl.SecurityServerImpl cannot be located. This is typically in the wssec.jar file.
Message.Explanation: The security server cannot be located. Ensure that the wssec.jar file is located in the classpath.
Message.UserResponse: The probable cause for this problem is that the class com.ibm.WebSphereSecurityImpl.SecurityServerImpl can not be located. This is typically in the wssec.jar file.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0509I=JSAS0509I: Claim client authentication at transport layer supported has been set. <claimTLClientAuthenticationSupported>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0300E=JSAS0300E: [{0}] Invalid message type returned from target. Retry the operation after a few minutes. If the problem persists, there should be messages on the server system which may give a better indication of what the problem is. Further tracing on the server may be necessary. Message: {1}, ErrorCode: {2}.
Message.Explanation: The message type sent from the server to the client was not valid. This commonly occurs when an exception is created by the server while processing a request. When this occurs, the request normally does not complete.
Message.UserResponse: Retry the operation after a few minutes. If the problem persists, there should be messages on the server system which may give a better indication of what the problem is. Further tracing on the server may be necessary.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1433I=JSAS1433I: The standard claim-QOP model has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0617E=JSAS0617E: The client configuration specifies the Custom authentication mechanism, but the server does not support it.
Message.Explanation: The authentication mechanism of the server is not supported by the client.
Message.UserResponse: Modify the authenticationTarget property in the client configuration to a value that is supported by the server.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0552I=JSAS0552I: Evaluation of the identity assertion layer failed.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0054E=JSAS0054E: [{0}] Unable to set invocation credentials. Retry the operation. Ensure the program is creating the credential properly before setting it as the invocation credential. You may need to restart the client or server which has the invalid credential. {1}
Message.Explanation: This error could occur for one of the following reasons: the credential is null, the credential is not a subtype of org.omg.SecurityLevel2.Credentials, the credential has been marked invalid during a failed login attempt, or when the security server was unavailable.
Message.UserResponse: Retry the operation. Ensure the program is creating the credential properly before setting it as the invocation credential. You may need to restart the client or server which has the invalid credential.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0508I=JSAS0508I: Claim client authentication at transport layer required has been set. <claimTLClientAuthenticationRequired>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0443E=JSAS0443E: [{0}] Request holder service data key for Security Context invalid. Ensure that the correct SAS.JAR is in the server and client classpath. There might be a mismatch between these files on the client and the server. {1}
Message.Explanation: The key used to find the security context is not valid.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure that the correct sas.jar file is in the server and client classpaths.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0479E=JSAS0479E: [{0}] Unable to sleep. Restart the server. {1}
Message.Explanation: A java runtime exception occurred while a thread was trying to sleep for a specified number of seconds.
Message.UserResponse: Restart the server.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1432I=JSAS1432I: The perform message confidentiality has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0616E=JSAS0616E: The client configuration specifies the LTPA authentication mechanism, but the server does not support it.
Message.Explanation: The authentication mechanism of the server is not supported by the client.
Message.UserResponse: Modify the authenticationTarget property in the client configuration to a value that is supported by the server.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0551I=JSAS0551I: Evaluation of the message layer failed.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0053E=JSAS0053E: [{0}] Unable to validate credential token. Retry the operation after a few minutes. If using request_login for Domino, ensure that Domino/WebSphere SSO is setup correctly.
Message.Explanation: The credential token is null, expired, or has been tampered with. Since the token is digitally signed, any modification of the bytes in the token will not verify. The most common reason for this error is due to a null token.
Message.UserResponse: Retry the operation after a few minutes. If using request_login for Domino, ensure that the Domino and WebSphere Signle Sign On (SSO) configuration has been configured correctly.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0507I=JSAS0507I: No claim secure transport layer has been set.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0442E=JSAS0442E: [{0}] ASSOC_REJECT message is illegal at the target. Retry the operation after a few minutes. Check the client configuration to ensure there''s nothing out of the ordinary that might be causing an exception to occur.
Message.Explanation: The ASSOC_REJECT message type is not expected to be received by the target server.
Message.UserResponse: You should retry the operation after several minutes. Review the sas.client.props file on the client to ensure the settings are all valid.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1431I=JSAS1431I: The perform message integrity has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0615E=JSAS0615E: The client configuration specifies the Kerberos authentication mechanism, but the server does not support it.
Message.Explanation: The authentication mechanism of the server is not supported by the client.
Message.UserResponse: Modify the authenticationTarget property in the client configuration to a value that is supported by the server.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0550I=JSAS0550I: Evaluation of the transport layer failed.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0052E=JSAS0052E: [{0}] Invalid credential token. Retry the operation after a few minutes. If using request_login for Domino, ensure that Domino/WebSphere SSO is setup correctly. {1}
Message.Explanation: The credential token is null, expired, or has been tampered with. Since the token is digitally signed, any modification of the bytes in the token will not verify. The most common reason for this error is due to a null token.
Message.UserResponse: Retry the operation after a few minutes. If using the request_login method for Domino, confirm that the Domino and WebSphere Signle Sign On (SSO) configuration has been configured correctly.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0506I=JSAS0506I: Claim secure transport layer with SSL/TLS supported has been set. <claimTransportAssocSSLTLSSupported>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0441E=JSAS0441E: [{0}] ASSOC_ACCEPT message is illegal at the target. Retry the operation after a few minutes. Check the client configuration to ensure there''s nothing out of the ordinary that might be causing an exception to occur.
Message.Explanation: The ASSOC_ACCEPT message type is not expected to be received by the target server.
Message.UserResponse: You should retry the operation after several minutes. Review the sas.client.props file on the client to ensure the settings are all valid.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0477E=JSAS0477E: [{0}] Invalid credential. Retry the operation. Ensure the program is creating the credential properly before setting it as the invocation credential. You may need to restart the client or server which has the invalid credential. {1}
Message.Explanation: The credential is either null, not a subtype of the org.omg.SecurityLevel2.Credentials class, or marked invalid. The credential could have been marked invalid during a failed log in attempt or when the security server was not available.
Message.UserResponse: Retry the operation. Ensure the program is creating the credential properly before setting it as the invocation credential. You might need to restart the client or server which has the invalid credential.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1430I=JSAS1430I: The perform message out-of-sequence detection has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0614E=JSAS0614E: The authentication mechanism OID supplied by the server is an unsupported OID for this WebSphere release.
Message.Explanation: The server is supplying an unsupported object ID (OID).
Message.UserResponse: Try using SSL client certificate authentication.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0051E=JSAS0051E: [{0}] Invalid authentication target. Verify that the security configuration has a valid authentication target selected.
Message.Explanation: The authentication target is not of the type BasicAuth, LocalOS or LTPA. Sometimes only LocalOS or LTPA are valid authentication targets for certain methods.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the security configuration has a valid authentication target selected.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0505I=JSAS0505I: Claim secure transport layer with SSL/TLS required has been set. <claimTransportAssocSSLTLSRequired>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0476E=JSAS0476E: [{0}] Invalid credential type. Ensure that the client authentication target in the client properties is set to a value that the server supports. {1}
Message.Explanation: The credential object passed to the server is not a type that the server supports.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure that the client authentication target in the client properties is set to a value that the server supports.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0613E=JSAS0613E: The server requires client authentication (e.g., userid/password or token), but the client does not support it.
Message.Explanation: The client currently will not accept BasicAuth authentication or any other client authentication mechanism.
Message.UserResponse: Configure the client for BasicAuth aclient authentication or contact the server administrator.

Message.MsgText: security.LoadSCI=JSAS0006I: Security connection interceptor initialized.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0504I=JSAS0504I: Claim stateless has been enabled.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0475E=JSAS0475E: [{0}] Invalid expiry time. Check to ensure the value passed into is_valid is not negative.
Message.Explanation: The value passed into the is_valid method is negative.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure the value passed into the is_valid method is not negative.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0612E=JSAS0612E: The client requires client authentication (e.g., userid/password or token), but the server does not support it.
Message.Explanation: The server currently will not accept BasicAuth authentication or any other client authentication mechanism.
Message.UserResponse: Configure the client for SSL client authentication or contact the server administrator.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0503I=JSAS0503I: Claim stateful has been enabled.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0539I=JSAS0539I: Perform identity assertion supported has been set. <performIdentityAssertionSupported>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0611E=JSAS0611E: No authentication mechanism is defined at client authentication layer.
Message.Explanation: The Common Secure Interoperability version 2 (CSIv2) tagged component did not specify an authentication mechanism.
Message.UserResponse: Retry the client application or restart the server to export the Interoperable Object Reference (IOR) for the object again.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1419I=JSAS1419I: The authentication target has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0502I=JSAS0502I: Realm name has not been set.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0538I=JSAS0538I: No perform client authentication has been set.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0473E=JSAS0473E: [{0}] Invalid mechanism type. Check the security configuration to ensure the properties are set correctly. Retry the operation.
Message.Explanation: The security mechanism is not a valid mechanism as defined in the mechanism factory.
Message.UserResponse: Check the security configuration to ensure the properties are set correctly. Retry the operation.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0610E=JSAS0610E: The server requires SSL Integrity but the client does not support it.
Message.Explanation: The server requires SSL Integrity but the client does not support it.
Message.UserResponse: Modify the client configuration to support Integrity.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0429E=JSAS0429E: [{0}] The configuration is inconsistent. The exact reason of the inconsistency will be in a preceding message.
Message.Explanation: This error occurs when a dependency between two configuration options is not met. For example, if an SSL connection is configured but the keystore file does not exist.
Message.UserResponse: This error will be preceded by additional error messages with further information.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1418I=JSAS1418I: Local operating system server-association has been enabled.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0191E=JSAS0191E: [{0}] Null or empty BasicAuth Token, unable to authenticate. Verify the information used to login. Retry the operation with a valid userid and password. If a properties login is performed, check the properties file to ensure a userid and password has been set.
Message.Explanation: The user name or password passed into the authenticate method was either null or not valid.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm the operation was performed with a valid user name and password. If a properties login is performed, confirm the user name and password have been set in the sas.client.props file.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0501I=JSAS0501I: Realm name has been set: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0537I=JSAS0537I: Perform client authentication supported has been set. <performClientAuthenticationSupported>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.RegisterCurrent=JSAS0005I: SecurityCurrent registered.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0472E=JSAS0472E: [{0}] The BasicAuth expiration time is smaller than the ORB request timeout; A method request could take longer than the period over which the requesting credentials will remain valid. If you are setting these properties explicitly, ensure that requestTimeout is smaller than requestCredsExpiration.
Message.Explanation: The com.ibm.CORBA.requestCredsExpiration property may not be smaller than the com.ibm.CORBA.requestTimeout property.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure that the com.ibm.CORBA.requestTimeout property is smaller than the com.ibm.CORBA.requestCredsExpiration property.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1461I=JSAS1461I: SSL security compound tag will be exported.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0428E=JSAS0428E: [{0}] The specified claim-QOP options are not valid. Verify that the above properties are consistent.
Message.Explanation: The com.ibm.CORBA.standardClaimQOPModels property is set to advanced. The following properties are not set consistently with that value: performClientAuthentication, performServerAuthentication, performMessageReplayDetection, performMessageOutOfSequenceDetection, performMessageIntegrity, and performMessageConfidentiality.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the above properties are consistent.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1417I=JSAS1417I: Local operating system client-association has been enabled.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0190E=JSAS0190E: [{0}] Invalid or null client security name, unable to authenticate. Verify the information used to login. Retry the operation with a valid userid. If a properties login is performed, check the properties file to ensure a userid has been set.
Message.Explanation: The user name passed into the authenticate method was either null or not valid.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm the operation was performed with a valid user name. If a properties login is performed, confirm the user name has been set in the sas.client.props file.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0500I=JSAS0500I: CSIv2 protocol has been enabled.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0536I=JSAS0536I: Perform client authentication required has been set. <performClientAuthenticationRequired>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0110E=JSAS0110E: [{0}] Client credentials were not the correct type. Ensure that the client program is correctly following the CORBA programming model. Also, verify that the correct version of SAS.JAR is in the client classpath. {1}
Message.Explanation: This indicates that the credentials object being passed to the current object are not Security Authentication Service (SAS) credentials but of some other type or no type was specified.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure that the client program is correctly following the Common Object Request Broker Architecture (CORBA) programming model. Also, verify that the correct version of the sas.jar file is in the client classpath.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0471E=JSAS0471E: [{0}] The requestCredsExpiration property is out of range; using the default {1}. Correct the value specified in the requestCredsExpiration property so that it is within the valid range.
Message.Explanation: The valid range for the requestCredsExpiration property is between 10 and 524160 minutes.
Message.UserResponse: Correct the value specified in the requestCredsExpiration property so that it is within the valid range.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1460I=JSAS1460I: Successfully loaded configured key file:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0427E=JSAS0427E: [{0}] The specified perform-QOP options are not valid. Verify that the above properties are consistent.
Message.Explanation: The com.ibm.CORBA.standardPerformQOPModels property is set to advanced. The following properties are not set consistently with that value: performClientAuthentication, performServerAuthentication, performMessageReplayDetection, performMessageOutOfSequenceDetection, performMessageIntegrity, and performMessageConfidentiality.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the above properties are consistent.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1416I=JSAS1416I: LTPA server-association has been enabled.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0535I=JSAS0535I: No perform message 40-bit SSL/TLS cipher suites has been set.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.GettingConfig=JSAS0001I: Security configuration initialized.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1415I=JSAS1415I: LTPA client-association has been enabled.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0534I=JSAS0534I: Perform message 40-bit SSL/TLS cipher suites supported has been set. <performMessageIntegritySupported>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0425E=JSAS0425E: [{0}] The login source is KeyTable, however the KeyTable file was not specified. Specify a KeyTable file on com.ibm.CORBA.keytabFileName if you intend to use the login source of KeyTable.
Message.Explanation: This message indicates an inconsistency in the configuration because a login source of the KeyTable type needs to have a KeyTable file specified.
Message.UserResponse: Specify a KeyTable file on com.ibm.CORBA.keytabFileName if you intend to use the login source of KeyTable.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1414I=JSAS1414I: SSL Type-I server-association has been enabled.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0533I=JSAS0533I: Perform message 40-bit SSL/TLS cipher suites required has been set. <performMessageIntegrityRequired>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0360E=JSAS0360E: [{0}] Security attribute list is null. Verify that the list of attributes that is trying to be set is not null. Retry the operation.
Message.Explanation: The attribute list was null when the call was made to the set_attributes method on the credential.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the list of attributes that is trying to be set is not null. Retry the operation.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0208E=JSAS0208E: [{0}] Internal error: system exception.
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0424E=JSAS0424E: [{0}] The login source is Properties, however either the userid or password were not specified. Specify a userid on com.ibm.CORBA.loginUserid and password on com.ibm.CORBA.loginPassword if you intend to use the login source of properties.
Message.Explanation: This indicates an inconsistency in the configuration because a login source of properties needs to have a userid and password specified.
Message.UserResponse: Specify a userid on the com.ibm.CORBA.loginUserid property and password on the com.ibm.CORBA.loginPassword password if you intend to use the login source of properties.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1413I=JSAS1413I: SSL Type-I client-association has been enabled.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1449I=JSAS1449I: The configuration appears to be complete.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.Protocol=JSAS0002I: Authentication protocol: {0}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0532I=JSAS0532I: No perform message 128-bit SSL/TLS cipher suites has been set.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0640E=JSAS0640E: The server requires SSL/TLS, but the client does not support it.
Message.Explanation: The connection was not successful because the server requires SSL but the client does not support it.
Message.UserResponse: If SSL is a requirement, configure the client to support SSL. If SSL is not a requirement, change the server configuration to support, not require, SSL.

Message.MsgText: security.IORInterceptor=JSAS0009I: IOR interceptor registered.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0250E=JSAS0250E: [{0}] Secure association compromised. Retry the operation. Might want to contact your network administrator to see if any network problems occurred during the time of the errors. Message={1}, ErrorCode={2}.
Message.Explanation: The message from the server has been corrupted. This could be due to message tampering or possibly an electrical surge causing the bytes to be rearranged.
Message.UserResponse: Retry the operation. If this problem persists, contact your network administrator to determine if any network problems occurred when the error occured.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0423E=JSAS0423E: [{0}] The completeness verification produced a verification result of {1}.
Message.Explanation: The expected verification result is Success(0). The other possible verification results are Unknown (-1), ConfigIncomplete (1), ConfigInconsistent (2), and ConfigWrong (3).
Message.UserResponse: This error will be preceded by additional error messages with further information.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1412I=JSAS1412I: DCE server-association has been enabled.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1448I=JSAS1448I: The security bootstrap repository port has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0531I=JSAS0531I: Perform message 128-bit SSL/TLS cipher suites supported has been set. <performMessageConfidentialitySupported>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0422E=JSAS0422E: [{0}] The configuration is incomplete. A preceding message will likely tell you the exact reason why it is incomplete. The likely reasons are no Bootstrap Repository location, no association options selected, or the configuration has not been initialized.
Message.Explanation: A verification result of ConfigIncomplete (1) has been returned.
Message.UserResponse: This error will be preceded by additional error messages with further information. The likely causes for this error are a missing Bootstrap Repository location, no association options selected, or the security configuration has not been initialized.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1411I=JSAS1411I: DCE client-association has been enabled.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1447I=JSAS1447I: The security service will not be disabled during bootstrap activation.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0530I=JSAS0530I: Perform message 128-bit SSL/TLS cipher suites required has been set. <performMessageConfidentialityRequired>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1410I=JSAS1410I: The principal was not set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1446I=JSAS1446I: The delegation mode has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0456W=JSAS0456W: WARNING in {0}: The certificate with alias {1} from keyStore {2} will be expired in {3} days.
Message.Explanation: A certificate in the keystore is about to expire.
Message.UserResponse: Open the keystore and validate the expiration dates for all the certificates in the keystore. Generate new certificates to replace the certificates that are about to expire.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0030W=JSAS2030W: [{0}] Trying unauthenticated login. Verify the userid/password supplied is correct. Try restarting the client program to resolve the problem. Increasing the credential timeout value could reduce the likelihood of this error occurring.
Message.Explanation: The credentials supplied are either invalid or null. An attempt is being made to login as unauthenticated. If the resource is unprotected, the invocation should succeed.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the user name and password supplied are correct. Try restarting the client program to resolve the problem. Increasing the credential timeout value could reduce the likelihood of this error occurring.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0420E=JSAS0420E: [{0}] None of the association options have been set. Ensure that at least one of these association options are set.
Message.Explanation: At least one of the following association options must be set in the sas.client.props file: DCEClientAssociationEnabled, DCEServerAssociationEnabled, SSLTypeIClientAssociationEnabled, SSLTypeIServerAssociationEnabled, LTPAClientAssociationEnabled, LTPAServerAssociationEnabled, LocalOSClientAssociationEnabled, LocalOSServerAssociationEnabled.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure that at least one of these association options are set.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1445I=JSAS1445I: The claim message confidentiality supported has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0629E=JSAS0629E: [{0}] MalformedURLException reading com.ibm.CORBA.ConfigURL={1}. Exception: {2}
Message.Explanation: The value of the com.ibm.CORBA.ConfigURL property is not in a valid URL format.
Message.UserResponse: Specify a valid value for the com.ibm.CORBA.ConfigURL property, and ensure there is only a single / after file: in the URL string.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0030E=JSAS0030E: [{0}] Unable to get Current. Check to ensure the correct Java class files are in the program classpath. Make sure you are not using the wrong version of SAS.JAR. {1}
Message.Explanation: This message indicates an internal error occurred when trying to access the Current class via the resolve_initial_references method.
Message.UserResponse: Check to ensure the correct java class files are in the program class path. Make sure you are not using the wrong version of SAS.JAR.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0203E=JSAS0203E: [{0}] Authentication Failed. Note: The propagation of native registry error information is disabled by default. You may enable it by setting the property "com.ibm.websphere.security.registry.propagateExceptionsToClient=true" from the server''s administrative console by navigating to Security -> Global security -> Custom properties.
Message.Explanation: The native registry exceptions do not flow to a pure client for security reasons. If your environment is protected, you may enable this feature.
Message.UserResponse: Set the property "com.ibm.websphere.security.registry.propagateExceptionsToClient=true" from the server's administrative console menu: Security -> Global Security -> Custom Properties.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0455E=JSAS0455E: ERROR in {0}: The certificate with alias {1} from keyStore {2} is expired.
Message.Explanation: A certificate in the keystore has expired.
Message.UserResponse: Open the keystore and validate the expiration dates for all the certificates in the keystore. Remove any expired certificates.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1444I=JSAS1444I: The claim message integrity supported has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0628E=JSAS0628E: [{0}] The authenticationRetryCount property contains a non-integer string value; the default is {1}.
Message.Explanation: The authenticationRetryCount property must contain an integer value.
Message.UserResponse: Specify an integer value for the authenticationRetryCount property.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0202E=JSAS0202E: [{0}] Credential token expired. {1}
Message.Explanation: The credential token associated with the user credential has expired. This is expected behavior when using the Lightweight Third-Party Authentication (LTPA).
Message.UserResponse: Close the client and login again.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1479W=JSAS1479W: The target realm [{0}] does not match the current realm [{1}]. Specify the target realm in the Trusted target realms field. From the AdminConsole, go to: Security -> Global Security -> RMI/IIOP security -> CSIv2 Outbound Authentication.
Message.Explanation: The target realm does not match the current realm. The application server did not send the client request because the target realm might not be trusted.
Message.UserResponse: Add the intended target realm to the Trusted target realms field using the admininstrative console at Security -> Global Security -> RMI/IIOP security -> CSIv2 Outbound Authentication.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0519I=JSAS0519I: No claim client authentication has been set.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0310E=JSAS0310E: [{0}] Invalid security attribute type, unable to authenticate. Verify the program to ensure that the attribute being accessed is a valid credential attribute. You may need to contact your system administrator to verify that all of the attributes you need have been set in the user registry. {1}
Message.Explanation: A security attribute is a value stored in the credential object such as userid or groupid. Either the type trying to be accessed is not a valid credential attribute type or the attribute being accessed is null.
Message.UserResponse: Verify the program to ensure that the attribute being accessed is a valid credential attribute. You may need to contact your system administrator to verify that all of the attributes you need have been set in the user registry.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0454E=JSAS0454E: [{0}] Could not create local credentials. Check the security configuration for com.ibm.CORBA.PrincipalName, com.ibm.CORBA.LoginUserid, and com.ibm.CORBA.LoginPassword properties to ensure they are valid. For the com.ibm.CORBA.PrincipalName, ensure the correct realm is specified in front of the userid (realm/userid). {1}
Message.Explanation: This error indicates that a login attempt to the server was not successful.
Message.UserResponse: Check the security configuration for the com.ibm.CORBA.PrincipalName, com.ibm.CORBA.UserID, and com.ibm.CORBA.Password properties to ensure they are all valid. For the com.ibm.CORBA.PrincipalName property, ensure the correct realm is specified in front of the user name.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1443I=JSAS1443I: The claim message out-of-sequence supported has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.
