Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0627E=JSAS0627E: [{0}] The com.ibm.CSI.protocol property has an invalid value: {1}. Setting the protocol to {2}.
Message.Explanation: The valid protocol values for the com.ibm.CSI.protocol property are ibm, csiv2, and both.
Message.UserResponse: Specify a valid value for the com.ibm.CSI.protocol property.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0201E=JSAS0201E: [{0}] Invocation credential realm does not match target''s realm: {0}. If using the SWAM authentication mechanism, you should switch to using LTPA instead for remote IIOP invocations.
Message.Explanation: Attempting a remote invocation over the Internet Inter-ORB Protocol (IIOP) using the Simple WebSphere Authentication Mechanism (SWAM) authentication mechanism is not supported.
Message.UserResponse: Retry the remote invocation using LTPA authentication mechanism configured in Global Security.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1478W=JSAS1478W: Security cannot be enabled because the ConfigURL property cannot be processed!
Message.Explanation: The com.ibm.CORBA.ConfigURL property specified in setupCmdLine.bat or on the java command line is not valid.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm the file being specified for the com.ibm.CORBA.ConfigURL property exists.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0518I=JSAS0518I: Claim client authentication supported has been set. <claimClientAuthenticationSupported>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0453E=JSAS0453E: [{0}] No credentials could be found identifying the local target. Check the com.ibm.CORBA.PrincipalName, com.ibm.CORBA.LoginUserid, and com.ibm.CORBA.LoginPassword properties to ensure they are valid. For the com.ibm.CORBA.PrincipalName, ensure the correct realm is specified in front of the userid (realm/userid).
Message.Explanation: The server credentials could not be found.
Message.UserResponse: Check the security configuration for the com.ibm.CORBA.PrincipalName, com.ibm.CORBA.LoginUserid, and com.ibm.CORBA.LoginPassword properties to ensure they are all valid. For the com.ibm.CORBA.PrincipalName property, ensure the correct realm is specified in front of the user name.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0489E=JSAS0489E: [{0}] Unauthenticated credentials can not be sent via Identity Assertion because they are not supported by the configuration.
Message.Explanation: The security configuration does not allow for an anonymous identity token.
Message.UserResponse: Make sure the client gets prompted and enters valid credentials.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1442I=JSAS1442I: The claim message replay detection supported has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0626E=JSAS0626E: [{0}] OID verification failed: credential OID ({1}) != configured OID ({2}).
Message.Explanation: The credential has an object ID (OID) which does not match the configured authenticationTarget OID.
Message.UserResponse: Modify the authenticationTarget property to support the credential OID.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0200E=JSAS0200E: [{0}] Attempt to establish a secure association at the target server failed. Check your userid/password to verify the correctness. Retry the operation after a few minutes. Message={1}, ErrorCode={2}
Message.Explanation: The attempt to authenticate the client has not been accepted.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the user name and password are correct, as an incorrect user name or password is usually the source of the problem. It is also possible that the security server was not available. Retry the opertion after a few minutes.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0409E=JSAS0409E: [{0}] The SSLCredentialsTimeout property contains a non-integer string value; using the default value of {1}. Correct the value specified in the property so that it is an integer number.
Message.Explanation: An integer value must be specified for this property.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm that the value specified in the property is an integer.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1477W=JSAS1477W: SECURITY CLIENT/SERVER CONFIG MISMATCH: The client security configuration (sas.client.props or outbound settings in GUI) does not support the server security configuration for the following reasons:
Message.Explanation: The configuration on the client is not consistent with the configuration on the server for the specific reasons displayed after the warning message.
Message.UserResponse: Use the specified reasons reported the warning message as a guideline to modify the client and server security configurations so that they match.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0517I=JSAS0517I: Claim client authentication required has been set. <claimClientAuthenticationRequired>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1506E=JSAS1506E: Kerberos WSCredential without GSSCredential can not go outbound with Kerberos authentication.
Message.Explanation: The client and server do not support the same authentication target.
Message.UserResponse: Examine the client and server authentication targets.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0452E=JSAS0452E: [{0}] The security context is no longer valid. Try to review the client or server security configuration files. If recent changes have been made you may want to undo these changes. {1}
Message.Explanation: This error typically occurs when adding a security session on the client or server.
Message.UserResponse: Review the sas.client.props file and the sas.server.props file for recent changes. If recent changes have been made, you migh want to undo these changes for troubleshooting purposes.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0488E=JSAS0488E: [{0}] An exception was thrown while registering the request interceptor to the orb. The exception is: {1}
Message.Explanation: This error usually indicates a problem with the Object Request Broker (ORB).
Message.UserResponse: Confirm that an orb.properties file exists in java/jre/lib directory.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1441I=JSAS1441I: The claim server-authentication supported has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0625E=JSAS0625E: [{0}] Cannot instantiate WSSecurityContext instance for OID: {1}
Message.Explanation: The object ID (OID) specified in the credential does not have a corresponding WSSecurityContext implementation.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure that the WSSecurityContext configuration specifies an implementation for this OID.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0408E=JSAS0408E: [{0}] The SSLCredentialsTimeout property is out of range; using the default value of {1}. Correct the value specified in the property so that it is in the valid range.
Message.Explanation: The valid range for the SSLCredentialsTimeout property is between 0 and 31,449,600 seconds.
Message.UserResponse: Correct the value specified in the property so that it is in the valid range.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0170E=JSAS0170E: [{0}] Null session handle in session table. Check to see if a server process has terminated just prior to receiving these errors. If a process has terminated, restart the process and retry the operation. Verify that the client userid/password is valid. If the login fails, the session will be deleted on the client side and the credentials will be marked invalid. If a retry occurs, you will likely see this error. Restart the client program after verifying the login info.
Message.Explanation: An attempt to access a security session from the session tables on the client or on the server was not successful. The session probably has already been deleted or has not been added. If the login fails, the session will be deleted on the client side and the credentials will be marked invalid.
Message.UserResponse: Determine if a server process was stopped prior to receiving this error. If a server process was stopped, restart the server process and retry the operation.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1476W=JSAS1476W: [{0}] The following exception was received from the server: {1}
Message.Explanation: This logs any system exception which occurs on the server by the security request interceptor or any other request interceptor called after the security request interceptor.
Message.UserResponse: This exception is sometimes normal, such as a NO_PERMISSION exception occurring due to a user name and password that are not valid. Otherwise, see the problem determination information on the WebSphere Application Server Support Web page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0516I=JSAS0516I: No claim message 40-bit SSL/TLS cipher suites has been set.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1505E=JSAS1505E: LTPA WSCredential can not go outbound with Kerberos authentication.
Message.Explanation: The client and server do not support the same authentication target.
Message.UserResponse: Examine the client and server authentication targets.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0451E=JSAS0451E: [{0}] Credentials do not contain a Public security name. The client should specify a userid and password in most cases in order to get authenticated.
Message.Explanation: The public security name is the client's user name. In this case, a user name was not specified.
Message.UserResponse: The client must specify a user name and password in most cases in order to authenticate.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1440I=JSAS1440I: The claim client-authentication supported has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0624E=JSAS0624E: [{0}] Exception caught when instantiating Custom authentication mechanism instance {1}, message: {2}, exception: {3}
Message.Explanation: The custom authentication mechanism when implements WSSecurityContext interface is having problems being instantiated.
Message.UserResponse: Review the constructor of this class to confirm the proper class is specified in the security configuration.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1475W=JSAS1475W: [{0}] The following exception occurred on the server, sending context error back to client: {1}
Message.Explanation: This logs any system exception which occurs on the server by the security interceptor or any other interceptor called after the security interceptor.
Message.UserResponse: This exception is sometimes normal, such as a NO_PERMISSION exception occurring due to a user name and password that are not valid. Otherwise, see the problem determination information on the WebSphere Application Server Support Web page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0515I=JSAS0515I: Claim message 40-bit SSL/TLS cipher suites supported has been set. <claimMessageIntegritySupported>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0060W=JSAS0060W: [{0}] Unable to build security context. Occasionally, problems with the client and/or server configuration is responsible for these errors. Often it''s related to SSL connections not being created. This could be due to invalid settings in the security configuration. The SAS.JAR may not be specified in the classpath or is not the same version as the server. The JDK you are using must also have the JSSE extension classes in /java/jre/lib/ext directory. The java.security file must include the IBMJCE provider.
Message.Explanation: This message indicates that the building of the security context was not successful. This exception can occur when the session cannot be found in the session table, or a java runtime exception occurs.
Message.UserResponse: Occasionally, problems with the client or server configuration is responsible for these errors. This exception commonly occurs when SSL connections are not being created. That could be because of settings that are not valid in the security configuration, the sas.jar file might not be specified in the class path or the serer versions might be different. Confirm that the JDK you are using has the Java Secure Socket Extension (JSSE) extension classes in the /java/jre/lib/ext directory and that the java.security file includes the IBMJCE provider.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0406W=JSAS2406W: [{0}] SSL Security Compound Tag not found in IOR. Verify that the client program is attempting the access the correct object. This message could be benign if the object method does not require security to be invoked.
Message.Explanation: The Interoperable Object Reference (IOR) does not contain an SSL security compound tag. This tag contains the port, required quality of protection (QOP) and supported QOP, target's client authentication type, realm name and full security name.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the client program is attempting to access the correct object. This message could be benign if the object method does not require security to be invoked.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1504E=JSAS1504E: The server does not support the client authentication mechanism: {0}
Message.Explanation: The client and server do not support the same authentication target.
Message.UserResponse: Examine the client and server authentication target.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0450E=JSAS0450E: [{0}] Failed to initialize security context. Have the client verify that the userid/password specified during login is valid. {1}
Message.Explanation: This error indicates that a client is trying to establish a secure association with the server but was unable to authenticate.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm that the user name and password specified during login are valid.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0486E=JSAS0486E: [{0}] A problem occurred while decoding the truststore password property. Retype the password on the trustword password property and restart the program. {1}
Message.Explanation: A java runtime exception occurred while decoding the truststore password property.
Message.UserResponse: Retype the password on the com.ibm. property and restart the program.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0623E=JSAS0623E: [{0}] The verificationLevel property contains an illegal option; the default is {1}.
Message.Explanation: Valid property values are activelycorrect, passivelycorrect, consistency, and completeness.
Message.UserResponse: Specify a valid value for the verification level property.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0406E=JSAS0406E: [{0}] The standardPerformQOPModels attribute contains an invalid option; defaulting to {1}. Correct the value specified on the standardPerformQOPModels property if you do not want to use Confidentiality.
Message.Explanation: The option specified in the standardPerformQOPModels property is not valid. Valid options for this property include Authenticity, Integrity, Confidentiality, and Advanced.
Message.UserResponse: Correct the value specified on the standardPerformQOPModels property if you do not want to use Confidentiality.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1474W=JSAS1474W: [{0}] Unable to refresh the server''s credentials, reset to minimum expiration time. Restart the server.
Message.Explanation: The server credential needs to be refreshed so that the token does not expire. This message indicates that the refresh was not successful. This could be due to a problem logging into the server to get a new credential token or the credential has been marked invalid. The expiration time will be set explicitly to temporarily correct the problem.
Message.UserResponse: Restart the server.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0514I=JSAS0514I: Claim message 40-bit SSL/TLS cipher suites required has been set. <claimMessageIntegrityRequired>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0405W=JSAS2405W: [{0}] Unable to get client security name from credentials. Restart the client so that new credentials will be created. Check with your user registry administrator to ensure the user data is valid.
Message.Explanation: This message indicates that the attributes stored in the credential can not be retrieved due to a java runtime exception.
Message.UserResponse: Restart the client to create new credentials. Confirm that the user data provided is consistent with the data in the user registry.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1503E=JSAS1503E: AuditServiceProvider failure logging audit event, Exception = {0}.
Message.Explanation: A failure occurred in the auditing subsystem, preventing the event from being processed/logged.
Message.UserResponse: Examine the exception for the cause of the problem.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0485E=JSAS0485E: [{0}] A problem occurred while decoding the keystore password property. Retype the password on the keystore password property and restart the program. {1}
Message.Explanation: A java runtime exception occurred while decoding the keystore password property.
Message.UserResponse: Retype the password on the keystore password property and restart the program.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0622E=JSAS0622E: [{0}] GSSEncodeDecodeException has occurred: {1}
Message.Explanation: An exception has occurred while encoding or decoding security information.
Message.UserResponse: See the problem determination information on the WebSphere Application Server Support Web page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support.

Message.MsgText: security.ServerCSI=JSAS0008I: Server request interceptor registered.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0405E=JSAS0405E: [{0}] The property contains a non-integer string value; defaulting to {1}. Correct the value specified in the property so that it is an integer number.
Message.Explanation: An integer value must be specified for this property.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm that the value specified in the property is an integer.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0513I=JSAS0513I: No claim message 128-bit SSL/TLS cipher suites has been set.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0549I=JSAS0549I: Coalescing client config with server security mechanism
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0340E=JSAS0340E: [{0}] Invalid communication direction for security feature. Ensure the call to get_security_features passes in org.omg.Security.CommunicationDirection._SecDirectionBoth.
Message.Explanation: The communication direction passed into the get_security_features method currently only the supports org.omg.Security.CommunicationDirection._SecDirectionBoth class.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure the call to the method get_security_features method passes in the org.omg.Security.CommunicationDirection._SecDirectionBoth class.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0404W=JSAS2404W: [{0}] SSL Security Tag not found in IOR. Verify that the client program is attempting the access the correct object. This message could be benign if the object method does not require security to be invoked.
Message.Explanation: The Interoperable Object Reference (IOR) does not contain an SSL security tag. This tag contains the port, required quality of protection (QOP) and supported QOP.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the client program is attempting to access the correct object. This message could be benign if the object method does not require security to be invoked.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1502E=JSAS1502E: Auditing is enabled but could not get a handle to the audit context objects.
Message.Explanation: Could not obtain a handle to the Audit context objects in order to be able to populate with event data.
Message.UserResponse: Examine the exception for the cause of the problem.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0484E=JSAS0484E: [{0}] A problem occurred while decoding the loginPassword property. Retype the password on the loginPassword property and restart the program. {1}
Message.Explanation: A java runtime exception occurred while decoding the loginPassword property.
Message.UserResponse: Retype the password on the loginPassword property and restart the program.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0621E=JSAS0621E: The target server does not support any identity token types.
Message.Explanation: The target server likely does not support Identity Assertion.
Message.UserResponse: The target server might need to review how it exports the tagged components. Contact the system administrator of the target server.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0404E=JSAS0404E: [{0}] The loginTimeout property is out of range. Correct the value so that it falls between 0 and 600 specified in seconds. Currently using the value: {1}
Message.Explanation: Ensure the value specified is between 0 and 600 seconds.
Message.UserResponse: Correct the value so that it falls between 0 and 600 specified in seconds.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1429I=JSAS1429I: The perform message replay detection has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0512I=JSAS0512I: Claim message 128-bit SSL/TLS cipher suites supported has been set. <claimMessageConfidentialitySupported>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0548I=JSAS0548I: Perform transport security mechanism should be defined when perform transport QOP is enabled. <performTransportAssocSSLTLSRequired>: {1}, <performTransportAssocSSLTLSSupported>: {2}, <performMessageConfidentialityRequired>: {3}, <performMessageConfidentialitySupported>: {4}, <performMessageIntegrityRequired>: {5}, <performMessageIntegritySupported>: {6}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0403W=JSAS2403W: [{0}] DCE Security Tag not found in IOR. Verify that the client program is attempting the access the correct object. This message could be benign if the object method does not require security to be invoked.
Message.Explanation: The Interoperable Object Reference (IOR) does not contain a Distributed Computing Environment (DCE) security tag. This tag contains the target security name, mechanism and required quality of protection (QOP).
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the client program is attempting to access the correct object. This message could be benign if the object method does not require security to be invoked.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1501E=JSAS1501E: [{0}] J2EEAuditEventFactory was not initialized.
Message.Explanation: This exception is likely caused by an error in the security configuration.
Message.UserResponse: Check your security configuration, specifically the J2EEAuditEventFactory implementation.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0620E=JSAS0620E: No supported naming mechanisms are defined in attribute layer for Identity Assertion.
Message.Explanation: A naming mechanism is needed to determine how to encode and decode the identity token.
Message.UserResponse: The receiving server might not support Identity Assertion. Try contacting the system administrator of the receiving server.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0403E=JSAS0403E: [{0}] The delegateCredentials property contains an illegal delegation mode. Correct the value specified on the delegateCredentials property. The default is None.
Message.Explanation: Valid delegateCredentials property values include None, Simple, Scoped, Traced, and MethodDefined.
Message.UserResponse: Correct the value specified on the delegateCredentials property. The default is None.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0439E=JSAS0439E: [{0}] Unable to get Credentials. Verify that the client set the credentials properly before invoking the request. Ensure that the correct userid/password was specified when logging in. {1}
Message.Explanation: On the server side, there must be a set of received credentials when communicating over SSL and Mutual Authentication is enabled. Without the received credentials the server will throw a NO_PERMISSION exception.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the client set the credentials properly before invoking the request. Ensure that the correct user name and password were specified when logging in.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1428I=JSAS1428I: The perform server-authentication has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0511I=JSAS0511I: Claim message 128-bit SSL/TLS cipher suites required has been set. <claimMessageConfidentialityRequired>: {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0547I=JSAS0547I: Perform transport security mechanism should be defined when perform transport client auth is enabled. <performTLClientAuthenticationRequired>: {1}, <performTLClientAuthenticationSupported>: {2}, <performTransportAssocSSLTLSRequired>: {3}, <performTransportAssocSSLTLSSupported>: {4}.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1500E=JSAS1500E: [{0}] AuditEventFactory initialization failed.
Message.Explanation: This exception is likely caused by an error in the security configuration or the registered factory did not implement the J2EEAuditEventFactory interface.
Message.UserResponse: Check your security configuration, specifically the AuditEventFactory implementation.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0120W=JSAS2120W: [{0}] Security enabled, but EstablishTrustInClient is not set in IOR. If mutual authentication is desired, check the standardPerformQOPModels property so that it is set to authenticity, integrity, or confidentiality.
Message.Explanation: The standardPerformQOPModels property in the sas.client.props file might not be set for mutual authentication.
Message.UserResponse: If mutual authentication is intended, ensure the standardPerformQOPModels property is set to authenticity, integrity, or confidentiality.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0402E=JSAS0402E: [{0}] The standardClaimQOPModels attribute contains an invalid option; using the default value: {1}. Correct the value specified on the standardClaimQOPModels property if you do not want to use Confidentiality.
Message.Explanation: The option specified in the standardClaimQOPModels property is not valid. Valid options for this property include Authenticity, Integrity, Confidentiality, and Advanced.
Message.UserResponse: Correct the value specified on the standardClaimQOPModels property if you do not want to use Confidentiality.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0438E=JSAS0438E: [{0}] Invalid initial reference name. Verify that security is enabled in the client/server configuration (com.ibm.CORBA.securityEnabled=true). Check the client program to ensure that a valid name is passed into "resolve_initial_references". {1}
Message.Explanation: This error indicates that the name passed into the "resolve_initial_references" method in the program is not valid or has not been registered.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that that the com.ibm.CORBA.securityEnabled property is set to true in the client and server configuration. Confirm that a valid name is being passed to the "resolve_initial_references" method in the client program.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1427I=JSAS1427I: The perform client-authentication has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0510I=JSAS0510I: No claim client authentication at transport layer has been set.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0546I=JSAS0546I: <performIdentityAssertionRequired> is not applicable in client configuration. Disabled the property.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0120E=JSAS0120E: [{0}] Unable to create SecurityContext object. Try to review the client security configuration file (sas.client.props). If recent changes have been made you may want to undo these changes. {1}
Message.Explanation: A problem occurred while trying obtain the security context object when adding a new security session. This typically occurs when the client is trying to login.
Message.UserResponse: Review the client security configuration file (sas.client.props) for recent changes. If recent changes have been made, you might want to undo these changes for troubleshooting purposes.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0437E=JSAS0437E: [{0}] The DCE tagged component was not correctly formed and can not be parsed. Ensure that the server version you are trying to connect to is supported. Make sure the SAS.JAR you are using on the client side is compatible with that of the server.
Message.Explanation: A SystemException occurred when parsing the tagged component.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm that you are connecting to a supported server version. Ensure that the sas.jar file you are using on the client side is compatible with that server.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1426I=JSAS1426I: The standard perform-QOP model has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0545I=JSAS0545I: <performIdentityAssertionSupported> is not applicable in client configuration. Disabled the property.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0011E=JSAS0011E: [{0}] Java Exception. Exception = {1}
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0480E=JSAS0480E: [{0}] Failed to find the correct entry in key file. Ensure that the property com.ibm.ssl.keyStoreFile is pointing to a keyfile which contains the realm and security name which you are looking for. {1}
Message.Explanation: The keyfile entry for the specified realm and security name was not found in the keyfile.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure that the com.ibm.ssl.keyStoreFile property is pointing to a keyfile which contains the realm and security name that you intended.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0400E=JSAS0400E: [{0}] Could not close the key file; processing will continue.
Message.Explanation: A java I/O Exception occurred while trying to close the keyfile.
Message.UserResponse: Processing should continue.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0436E=JSAS0436E: [{0}] The configuration is ambiguous about which security mechanism to use. Try to review the client or server security configuration files. If recent changes have been made you may want to undo these changes. {1}
Message.Explanation: This error indicates that the client or server configuration properties are not valid. Another possibility is that some of the configuration properties are conflicting with each other, as certain properties cannot be set together.
Message.UserResponse: Review the sas.client.props file or the sas.server.props file for recent changes. If recent changes have been made, you might want to undo these changes for troubleshooting purposes.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1425I=JSAS1425I: The SSL port has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0609E=JSAS0609E: The client requires SSL Integrity but the server does not support it.
Message.Explanation: The client requires SSL Integrity but the server does not support it.
Message.UserResponse: Remove the integrity requirement from the client. If this is not possible, configure the server to support it.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0544I=JSAS0544I: <claimIdentityAssertionSupported> is not applicable in client configuration. Disabled the property.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0010E=JSAS0010E: [{0}] Null reference to Vault. Security may be disabled. Exception: {1}.
Message.Explanation: This message indicates that an error occurred when creating a vault instance during initialization of the server.
Message.UserResponse: Enable security. If security is already enabled, see the problem determination information on the WebSphere Application Server Support Web page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0435E=JSAS0435E: [{0}] Credentials are invalid. Login again to get new credentials. Sometimes it is necessary to restart the client and/or server to ensure that you are using new credentials. Once credentials are marked invalid, they cannot become valid again. {1}
Message.Explanation: The invalid flag on the credential object has been set to true. This usually means the credential was not accepted by the server when trying to authenticate. A NO_PERMISSION exception has likely been created by the server.
Message.UserResponse: Log on again to pass new credentials. It might be needed to restart the client and the server to ensure that you are using the new credentials. Once credentials are marked invalid, they cannot become valid again.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0608E=JSAS0608E: The server requires SSL Confidentiality but the client does not support it.
Message.Explanation: The server requires SSL confidentiality but the client does not support it.
Message.UserResponse: Set the com.ibm.CSI.performTransportAssocSSLTLSSupported property to true in the sas.client.props file to support confidentiality.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0543I=JSAS0543I: Claim transport security mechanism should be defined when claim transport QOP is enabled. <claimTransportAssocSSLTLSRequired>: {1}, <claimTransportAssocSSLTLSSupported>: {2}, <claimMessageConfidentialityRequired>: {3}, <claimMessageConfidentialitySupported>: {4}, <claimMessageIntegrityRequired>: {5}, <claimMessageIntegritySupported>: {6}.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0370E=JSAS0370E: [{0}] Security attribute list contains null attribute type or attribute family. Verify that the list of attributes that is trying to be set does not contain a null attribute. Retry the operation.
Message.Explanation: The attribute list contained an attribute type which was null when the call was made to the set_attributes method on the credential.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the list of attributes that is trying to be set does not contain a null attribute type. Retry the operation.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1423I=JSAS1423I: The SSL credentials timeout has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1459I=JSAS1459I: The BasicAuth credentials expiration has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0607E=JSAS0607E: The client requires SSL Confidentiality but the server does not support it.
Message.Explanation: The client requires SSL confidentiality but the server does not support it.
Message.UserResponse: Remove the SSL confidentiality requirement from the client. If this is not possible, configure the server to support it.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0542I=JSAS0542I: Claim transport security mechanism should be defined when claim transport client auth is enabled. <claimTLClientAuthenticationRequired>: {1}, <claimTLClientAuthenticationSupported>: {2}, <claimTransportAssocSSLTLSRequired>: {3}, <claimTransportAssocSSLTLSSupported>: {4}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0433E=JSAS0433E: [{0}] The performClientAuthentication is set, but none of the server association options are set. Ensure that at least one of the server association properties are set to true.
Message.Explanation: The property com.ibm.CORBA.performClientAuthentication is set. One of the following properties must also be set: SSLTypeIServerAssociationEnabled, SSLTypeIIServerAssociationEnabled, LTPAServerAssociationEnabled, or LocalOSServerAssociationEnabled.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure that at least one of the server association properties are set to true.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0469E=JSAS0469E: [{0}] The IOR is not correctly formed -- the connection will be refused. Ensure that the client version you are using is supported by the server. Check the SAS.JAR date and size and verify it is the same as that of the server. Check the classpath to ensure it includes the correct version of SAS.JAR.
Message.Explanation: There are values in the Interoperable Object Reference (IOR) that require a value but are currently null. This usually indicates that an exception occurred while trying to read them or there is an interoperability problem with another version of the server.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure that the client version you are using is supported by the server. Check the sas.jar file date and size and verify it is the same as that of the server. Check the classpath to ensure it includes the correct version of SAS.JAR.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1422I=JSAS1422I: The SSL session timeout has been set:
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1458I=JSAS1458I: BasicAuth credentials will not expire.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0606E=JSAS0606E: The server requires SSL client certificate authentication but the client does not support it.
Message.Explanation: The client is not configured to use SSL client certificate authentication.
Message.UserResponse: Review the client configuration to ensure it is set up to perform SSL client certificate authentication.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0541I=JSAS0541I: Trusted principal list should be defined for Identity Assertion. <claimIdentityAssertion>: {1}. TrustedPrincipalList is not defined.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1457I=JSAS1457I: [{0}] We couldn''t close the security bootstrap repository. {1}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0605E=JSAS0605E: The client supports SSL client certificate authentication but the server does not support it.
Message.Explanation: The server will not authenticate the client using SSL client certificates.
Message.UserResponse: Connect using BasicAuth client authentication, specifying a user name and password.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0540I=JSAS0540I: No perform identity assertion has been set.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0150E=JSAS0150E: [{0}] Unable to find session in session table. Retry the operation. If the error repeats itself, restart the client program. Check the client properties to ensure the login information is correct.
Message.Explanation: This error indicates that the session key was not found in the session table. This error may be a result of a different problem. Problems such as an invalid credential or a security service not being available are common causes for this error.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, check the client properties to ensure the login information is correct and restart the client program.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0186E=JSAS0186E: [{0}] Authentication with BasicAuth Token not supported. Check the client code to ensure it''s not calling the wrong principal authenticator. Resubmit the request after waiting a few minutes.
Message.Explanation: Trying to authenticate a BasicAuth token which consists of just a user name and password in either the LTPA or LocalOS PrincipalAuthenticator class.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm the client code is not calling the wrong principal authenticator. Resubmit the request after waiting a few minutes.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0431E=JSAS0431E: [{0}] The passive correctness verification produced a verification result of {1}
Message.Explanation: The expected verification result is Success (0). The other possible verification results are: Unknown (-1), ConfigIncomplete (1), ConfigInconsistent (2), and ConfigWrong (3).
Message.UserResponse: This error will be preceded by additional error messages with further information.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0467E=JSAS0467E: [{0}] The host address in the IOR is null or blank. Make sure the version of SAS.JAR is valid for the WebSphere release you are running. Restart the server and try the operation again.
Message.Explanation: The host address of the server is null as read from the Interoperable Object Reference (IOR) that the server exported.
Message.UserResponse: Make sure the version of the sas.jar file is valid for the application server you are using. Restart the server and try the operation again.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1456I=JSAS1456I: Trying again to form a secure association with the target.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0604E=JSAS0604E: The client requires SSL client certificate authentication but the server does not support it.
Message.Explanation: The server does not support SSL client authentication.
Message.UserResponse: Connect using BasicAuth client authentication, specifying a user name and password.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0185E=JSAS0185E: [{0}] Validation of BasicAuth Token not supported. Check the client code to ensure it''s not calling validate incorrectly. Resubmit the request after waiting a few minutes.
Message.Explanation: A BasicAuth token, consisting of only a user name and password, must be authenticated and can not be validated.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm that the validate method is not being called. The request can be retried after waiting for a few minutes.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0040W=JSAS2040W: [{0}] No ConnectionData object attached to RequestHolder. Verify the classpath on the client and server both contain the same SAS.JAR and the same SAS e-fixes.
Message.Explanation: The type of connection data object is not valid. There could be a problem with the classes loaded from the classpath.
Message.UserResponse: Verify the classpath on the client and server both contain the same sas.jar file and have the same interim fixes.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0430E=JSAS0430E: [{0}] The consistency verification produced a verification result of {1}
Message.Explanation: The expected verification result is Success (0). The other possible verification results are: Unknown (-1), ConfigIncomplete (1), ConfigInconsistent (2), and ConfigWrong (3).
Message.UserResponse: This error will be preceded by additional error messages with further information.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0466E=JSAS0466E: [{0}] An I/O error occurred while processing the message buffer. Retry the operation. {1}
Message.Explanation: A java InputStream read error occurred.
Message.UserResponse: Retry the operation.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS1455I=JSAS1455I: Unable to login principal: null authentication information.
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0603E=JSAS0603E: The server does not support SSL/TLS, but the client is configured to require it.
Message.Explanation: The connection was not successful because the client requires SSL but the server does not support it.
Message.UserResponse: If SSL is not a requirement, change the client configuration to support, not require, SSL. If SSL is a requirement, configure the server to support SSL.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0639E=JSAS0639E: The ID received for identity assertion ({0}) is not trusted by the server, most likely because the ID does not have CONTROL access to the CBIND profile in the RACF (Resource Access Control Facility) database.
Message.Explanation: When the platform is z/OS and the Local Operating System is configured as the user realm, the asserted ID must have CONTROL authority for the CBIND profile in RACF in order for the server to establish trust.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the ID listed in the message has CONTROL permission to the CBIND profile in RACF.

Message.MsgText: security.JSAS0040E=JSAS0040E: [{0}] Unable to initialize security context. Check to ensure the userid/password is valid. Restart the client and retry the operation.
Message.Explanation: The outcome of the init_security_context method is not as expected. This error can be caused by any secure association issues with the target server. There are times when this is benign such as for method invocations that do not require security.
Message.UserResponse: Check to ensure the user name and password are valid. Restart the client and retry the operation.

Message.MsgText: security.Principal=JSAS0004I: Principal name: {0}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: security.AuthTarget=JSAS0003I: Authentication mechanism: {0}
Message.Explanation: This message is for informational purposes only.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.
